pydexpi.toolkits.model_toolkit module

Dexpi Model Toolkit

This module contains functions and tools that concern overall of an overall dexpi model/conceptual model.

pydexpi.toolkits.model_toolkit.combine_dexpi_models(models: list[DexpiModel], **kwargs)[source]

This function combines the contents of a list of dexpi models and returns a new model with its contents.

The combination is performed on all list attributes of the conceptual model. The meta data attribute and the data attributes of the dexpi model can be passed in via kwargs.

Parameters:

models (list[DexpiModel]) – The list of dexpi models to be combined.

Returns:

The combined dexpi model.

Return type:

DexpiModel

Raises:

NotImplementedError – Combining diagram information is not yet implemented. If any model has diagram or shapeCatalog attributes that are not None, Error is raised.

pydexpi.toolkits.model_toolkit.get_all_instances_in_model(the_model: DexpiBaseModel, dexpi_classes=None)[source]

Recursively discover and collect all instances of specified classes within a model.

This function traverses the attributes of the provided model object, recursively inspecting its attributes and sub-attributes to find all instances of the specified classes. The function returns a list of all discovered instances.

Parameters:

  • the_model (DexpiBaseModel) – The root model object to inspect.

  • dexpi_classes (class or tuple of classes, optional) – A tuple of class types to discover within the model. Only instances of these classes will be collected. If None, all objects are collected.

Returns:

A list of all discovered instances of the specified classes within the model.

Return type:

list

pydexpi.toolkits.model_toolkit.get_instances_with_attribute(the_model: DexpiBaseModel, attribute_name: str, target_value=None, dexpi_classes=None)[source]

Retrieve all subinstances associated to a dexpi model that have an attribute with a specified name and target value. The dexpi model is searched recursively through compositional attributes of all levels.

Parameters:

  • the_model (DexpiBaseModel) – The model to be searched.

  • attribute_name (str) – The name of the attribute to be identified.

  • target_value (Any, optional) – The value this attribute is supposed to have. Can be none, in which case any value is permitted

  • dexpi_classes (tuple, optional) – Can specify the classes if only certain class types are to be considered. If None, all are considered, by default None.

Returns:

List of discovered instances that have the attribute specified.

Return type:

list

pydexpi.toolkits.model_toolkit.import_model_contents_into_model(target_model: DexpiModel, import_models: list[DexpiModel])[source]

Imports the contents of passed models into target model. Conceptually similar to combine_dexpi_models, but the target_model is manipulated in place and its other, non-list attributes are preserved.

Parameters:

  • target_model (DexpiModel) – The model that is manipulated in place and that the other models are imported into.

  • import_models (list[DexpiModel]) – The models that are to be imported to the target.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – Combining diagram information is not yet implemented. If any model has diagram or shapeCatalog attributes that are not None, Error is raised.

pydexpi.toolkits.model_toolkit.object_is_in_model(dexpi_model: DexpiModel, dexpi_object: DexpiBaseModel)[source]

Checks if the given dexpi_object is in some way a member of the given dexpi_model.

Parameters:

  • dexpi_model (DexpiModel) – The model to be searched for the object.

  • dexpi_object (DexpiBaseModel) – The object to be searched for in the model.

Returns:

True if object is found in the model, False otherwise

Return type:

bool
